channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: AI Adoption Fuels 'Massive' Cloud Attack Surface Expansion, Palo Alto Networks Report Warns
item.description:
Palo Alto Networks' 2025 'State of Cloud Security Report' reveals that the rapid adoption of AI is creating an unprecedented expansion of the cloud attack surface. The study, surveying 2,800 security leaders, found that 99% of organizations have had their AI systems attacked in the last year. The us...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: French Interior Ministry Confirms Cyberattack Compromised Email Servers
item.description:
The French Ministry of the Interior has confirmed its email servers were compromised in a cyberattack detected between December 11 and 12, 2025. Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez stated that attackers stole staff email passwords, allowing them to access an unknown number of document files. While the g...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'ConsentFix' Phishing Attack Hijacks Microsoft Accounts, Bypassing MFA via Azure CLI Abuse
item.description:
A novel and sophisticated phishing attack dubbed 'ConsentFix' allows attackers to hijack Microsoft accounts without stealing passwords or bypassing multi-factor authentication (MFA). Discovered by Push Security, the browser-native attack tricks users into completing a fake verification process that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Cloud Security, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: New Zealand Launches Massive Public Alert, Warning 26,000 Citizens of Lumma Stealer Malware Infections
item.description:
In a first-of-its-kind campaign, New Zealand's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is emailing approximately 26,000 people to warn them of potential infection by the Lumma Stealer malware. The potent information-stealing software targets Windows devices to covertly harvest sensitive data, includin...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: MITRE Extends D3FEND Cybersecurity Framework to Operational Technology (OT)
item.description:
MITRE has officially extended its D3FEND cybersecurity framework to include Operational Technology (OT), providing a standardized knowledge base of defensive techniques for cyber-physical systems. Announced on December 16, 2025, the NSA-funded initiative aims to create a common language for securing...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Security Operations

item.title: 'Operation MoneyMount-ISO' Phishing Campaign Deploys Phantom Stealer via Malicious ISOs
item.description:
A financially motivated, Russian-language phishing campaign dubbed 'Operation MoneyMount-ISO' is actively targeting finance and accounting departments to deploy the Phantom information-stealing malware. According to researchers at Seqrite Labs, the attack uses emails with fake payment confirmations ...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Actor

item.title: SoundCloud and Pornhub Confirm User Data Exposure in Separate Breaches, One Via Third-Party
item.description:
Both SoundCloud and Pornhub have confirmed security incidents exposing user data. SoundCloud suffered a direct breach of an ancillary service dashboard, resulting in the exfiltration of email addresses and public profile information for up to 28 million users (20% of its user base). The company stat...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Orders Federal Agencies to Patch Actively Exploited Critical GeoServer XXE Flaw
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability in OSGeo GeoServer, CVE-2025-58360, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score up to 9.8, allows an unauthenticated remo...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

item.title: Active Attacks Exploit Critical Fortinet SSO Bypass Flaws to Gain Admin Access
item.description:
Security firm Arctic Wolf has observed active exploitation of two critical authentication bypass vulnerabilities in Fortinet products, CVE-2025-59718 and CVE-2025-59719. Both flaws, rated 9.1 in severity, allow an unauthenticated attacker to bypass FortiCloud single sign-on (SSO) by forging a SAML m...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: FreePBX Patches Critical Auth Bypass and RCE Flaws; Update VoIP Platforms Immediately
item.description:
The popular open-source VoIP platform FreePBX has been updated to fix several serious security vulnerabilities, including a critical authentication bypass (CVE-2025-66039) with a 9.3 CVSS score. This flaw, present in a non-default configuration, allows an attacker to bypass the admin login and poten...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'PyStoreRAT' Malware Spreads Via Fake OSINT and AI Tools on GitHub
item.description:
A new malware campaign is distributing an information-stealing Remote Access Trojan (RAT) called 'PyStoreRAT' through fake GitHub repositories. Threat actors create repositories for what appear to be legitimate OSINT, AI, or DeFi tools, artificially inflating their popularity with fake stars and for...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: 700Credit Data Breach Exposes PII of 5.6 Million Individuals
item.description:
The U.S. fintech company 700Credit, a major provider of credit reports and data services to the automotive industry, has disclosed a data breach affecting at least 5.6 million individuals. The incident, which occurred in October 2025, resulted in an unauthorized actor gaining access to and stealing ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Regulatory

item.title: New 'Gentlemen' Ransomware Group Deploys Advanced GPO and BYOVD Attacks
item.description:
A new ransomware operation, identifying itself as the "Gentlemen" group, has been observed conducting double-extortion attacks against corporate networks. The group employs sophisticated techniques to achieve its objectives, including the manipulation of Group Policy Objects (GPOs) for wide-scale ra...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

item.title: CVSS 10.0: Atlassian Patches Critical RCE Flaw in Apache Tika Dependency
item.description:
Atlassian has issued security updates for a critical vulnerability, CVE-2025-66516, in the Apache Tika parser library, a third-party dependency used in many of its products. The flaw, which carries a perfect CVSS score of 10.0, is an XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. It can be explo...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: xHunt Espionage Group Returns, Targeting Kuwait with New PowerShell Backdoors
item.description:
The cyber-espionage threat actor known as xHunt has resumed operations with a new campaign targeting organizations in Kuwait. Active since at least 2018, the group is focusing its latest attacks on the shipping, transportation, and government sectors. Researchers have observed xHunt infiltrating net...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

item.title: New '01flip' Ransomware, Written in Rust, Targets Critical Infrastructure in APAC
item.description:
A new and stealthy cross-platform ransomware strain named "01flip" has been discovered targeting critical infrastructure organizations in the Asia-Pacific region. The malware is written in the Rust programming language, enabling it to be compiled for both Windows and Linux systems and enhancing its ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: LastPass Fined £1.2M by UK Regulator Over 2022 Security Failures
item.description:
The UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has fined password manager provider LastPass £1.2 million (approximately $1.6 million) for significant security failures that led to a major data breach in 2022. The regulator found that LastPass failed to implement adequate technical and security mea...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Data Breach, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: India Confirms GPS Spoofing Attacks Targeted Seven Major Airports
item.description:
The Indian government has officially confirmed that a series of cyber incidents involving GPS spoofing have occurred at seven of the nation's major airports. The attacks, which targeted airports in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Bengaluru among others, disrupted navigation data for aircraft utilizing G...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Apple Rushes iOS 26.2 Update to Patch Two Actively Exploited Zero-Days
item.description:
Apple has released an emergency security update, iOS 26.2 and iPadOS 26.2, to address 26 vulnerabilities. Among these are two critical zero-day flaws, CVE-2025-43529 and CVE-2025-14174, both residing in the WebKit browser engine. The company confirmed reports that these vulnerabilities have been act...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in Sierra Wireless Routers
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical vulnerability in Sierra Wireless AirLink routers, CVE-2018-4063, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score as high as 9.9, is an unrestricted file upload vulnerability t...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Germany Summons Russian Ambassador Over Suspected Air Traffic Control Cyberattack
item.description:
In a significant diplomatic escalation, the German government has summoned the Russian Ambassador to Berlin following allegations of a cyberattack targeting the nation's air traffic control (ATC) systems. The incident, reported on December 13, 2025, has raised grave concerns about the security of Ge...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: KillSec Ransomware Hits U.S. Financial Firm Daba Finance in Data Extortion Attack
item.description:
The ransomware group known as KillSec has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Daba Finance Inc., a financial services company in the United States. On December 14, 2025, the group listed the company on its data leak site, employing a double-extortion tactic by threatening to release sen...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: WestJet Data Breach Exposes Info of 1.2 Million Passengers; Scattered Spider Suspected
item.description:
Canadian airline WestJet has disclosed a significant data breach that occurred in June 2025, impacting approximately 1.2 million passengers. The compromised data includes sensitive personal information such as names, contact details, and travel documentation. While investigations are ongoing, some r...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: "Catastrophic" Data Breach at Norwegian News Agency NTB Exposes Customer Data
item.description:
NTB (Norsk Telegrambyrå), Norway's leading news and content provider, has disclosed what it calls a "catastrophic" data breach that occurred in early December 2025. The company announced on December 13 that attackers exploited vulnerabilities in its systems to gain unauthorized access to its custome...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

item.title: Eswatini Faces Cybersecurity Crisis as Government Fails to Act on Rising Threats
item.description:
A report published on December 13, 2025, reveals a deepening cybersecurity crisis in the Kingdom of Eswatini. The nation is experiencing a significant increase in cyberattacks targeting citizens, businesses, and government bodies. This surge is compounded by a lack of effective government response, ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Other
